snippet: British researchers report, on the other hand, that male fruit flies do not like to mate with the same female twice, and avoid her sister. The sense of smell also helps fruit flies figure it all out.
abstract: Study in journal The Proceedings of the Royal Society B reports on the complexity of mating patterns among fruit flies.
lead_paragraph: British researchers report, on the other hand, that male fruit flies do not like to mate with the same female twice, and avoid her sister. The sense of smell also helps fruit flies figure it all out.

headline.main: Female Fruit Flies Like One Mate, or His Brother
headline.print_headline: Insects: Female Fruit Flies Like One Mate, or His Brother

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
